AttackerCapabilities: Familiarity with the mutool command-line utility

Vulnerabilities: Lack of validation on uploaded PDF files
Use of MD5 hash for file comparison

Steps.Description: The attacker identifies that the challenge involves MD5 collisions and PDF files.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker hypothesizes that they can generate two colliding PDF files with the same MD5 hash.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker searches for existing tools or code that can generate MD5 collisions for PDF files.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker finds the necessary code and tools to generate colliding PDFs.

Steps.Description: The attacker generates two PDF files with different content but the same MD5 hash.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that by merging two PDF files with different content, they can create two colliding PDFs with the same MD5 hash.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker uses the mutool utility to merge two PDF files and create two colliding PDFs.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully generates two colliding PDF files with the same MD5 hash.

Steps.Description: The attacker uploads the colliding PDFs to the challenge website.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker expects that uploading the colliding PDFs will trigger the vulnerability and unlock the flag.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker uploads the colliding PDFs to the challenge website.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully unlocks the flag and gains access to the source code.
